sections.name: Purpose of This Domain
tasks: Provide the **technical backbone** that supports governance, coordination, narrative, and participation
Ensure that tools reinforce values rather than distort them

sections.name: High-Level Goals
tasks: Tools can be swapped without collapse
Tasks can be executed without bottlenecking on one person
Technical complexity is hidden from newcomers but accessible to builders
Governance, agreements, and contributions can be tracked without coercion

sections.name: 1. System Architecture & Spine
tasks: What layer each tool belongs to
Ability to swap tools without collapsing the system

sections.name: 8. Security, Resilience, and Failure Modes
tasks: No catastrophic collapse if one tool fails

sections.name: Dependencies & Staging
tasks: Not everything here can be built at once.
Some systems should remain conceptual until the underlying workflow is stable.
This domain should be staged in phases and built only when needed.

sections.name: Relationship to Internal Workflow
tasks: This domain supports the execution model:
Status tracked via one Project board
Tech systems must reinforce that model, not conflict with it.
Build bridges only when clarity exists.
Use automation only when it reduces human overhead.

sections.name: What Success Looks Like (At This Stage)
tasks: A stable, readable tech spine map exists
A working task execution system exists (GitHub Issues + Project board)
Volunteers can enter and find tasks without confusion
Core documents are accessible through bots and/or indexed reference
The system can evolve without collapsing

sections.name: Relationship to Other Domains
tasks: This domain supports all other domains by providing infrastructure and clarity.
It must remain subordinate to governance and agreements.
It must not become an authority layer.
It exists to enable human coordination at scale.

sections.name: Summary
tasks: Technology is the infrastructure that allows the mission to operate.
The goal is coherence, resilience, and human-centered coordination.
